title: All Quiet on the Western Front
author: Erich Maria Remarque
synopsis: A soldier's experience in World War I.
notes: Read the novel then watched the netflix movie. Was serving the nation when I was reading this. Really liked the banality of the characters, and how the main character dies in the final hours of the war. The delay in the treaty which cause ens of thousands more unnecessary deaths was due to having a 'poetic' timing to end the war. Really a foolish waste of lives just to satisfy the hubris of leaders, just like the war in general.

title: No Longer Human
author: Osamu Dazai
synopsis: A dark exploration of alienation and despair.
notes: Love a book where the author is a terrible person, and doesn't seek redemption but death. Every step he takes leads him deeper into the abyss, and the introspection worsens the suffering.

synopsis: A young boy is trained to save humanity from alien threat.
